snippet: Simon Doonan’s tongue-in-cheek book says straight food is heavy and gay food is lighter and more decorative. Mix the two, he advises, to stay slim.
abstract: Simon Doonan, author and humorist, has a new tongue-in-cheek book, Gay Men Don't Get Fat; says that the vast range of the world’s culinary options can be boiled down to two core categories--gay food and straight food.
lead_paragraph: Simon Doonan’s tongue-in-cheek book says straight food is heavy and gay food is lighter and more decorative. Mix the two, he advises, to stay slim.
